description: This course offers an intensive study of Afrian-American religious thought with particular emphasis
on the 20th century. Structured thematically, the course covers: African-American religious roots;
African-American Christian thought with particular emphasis on the Christ event in terms of
redemption, salvation, and liberation; Africentrism and Black Nationalism as interpretive and
critical lenses of African-American religious experience; and African-American responses to the
theodical, i.e., the problem of evil and suffering. Prerequisite: BTS-B.
fullname: African-American Religious Thought in the 20th Century
